How to watch the Tour of Britain Women for free

The revamped Tour of Britain Women kicks off today in Welshpool with some of the world’s best cyclists competing on British roads in the Women’s WorldTour for the first time since, well, a week and a half ago.

Many of our readers may be making a trip to catch the action roadside, and you can find the full routes as well as the start list in our complete guide to the race, but for cycling fans not living in Wales or northwest England, it’s once again time to get the multiscreen set-up going. You’ll have to stick the Dauphine on your TV, because live coverage of the Tour of Britain Women will only be available via the internet, with ITV4 showing daily highlights packages at 8pm each evening.

Never fear though, because although the race will be streaming live on Discovery+ in the UK, Italy, Netherlands and Germany, on Max in the US, Scandinavia, Spain and central and eastern Europe, and on the Eurosport app in the rest of Europe, the Tour of Britain Women will be streamed live on British Cycling’s YouTube page for free.

Coverage will be hosted by an all-women commentary team of Rebecca Charlton, Hannah Walker, Dani Rowe and Joanna Rowsell. Here’s the schedule with the link to watch each stage:

Stage 1: Thursday 6th June, Welshpool – Llandudno

From 13:00 BST, watch here.

Stage 2: Friday 7th June, Wrexham – Wrexham

From 13:15 BST, watch here.

Stage 3: Saturday 8th June, Warrington – Warrington

From 10:15 BST (flag to flag coverage), watch here.

Stage 4: Sunday 9th June, National Cycling Centre – Leigh

From 11:00 BST (flag to flag coverage), watch here.
